title: U.S. Lawmakers Ask White House to Punish South Africa for Supporting Russia
description: South Africa is accused of helping supply Russia with weapons for the Ukraine war, a charge that South Africa denies.

title: Ukraine Claims More Small Advances in Counteroffensive
description: Military analysts said it would take weeks or months to gauge the success of the attacks Ukraine mounted last week across a broad stretch of the front lines.

title: NATO Members’ Major Air Exercise Sends Message to Russia
description: More than 200 planes from 25 countries gathered in Germany for the largest-scale war games in decades, held with an eye on the war in Ukraine.

title: Netanyahu Trial Gets a Hollywood Mention From a Political Rival
description: Yair Lapid, a former colleague and now nemesis of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, testified that he had been asked to help a wealthy film producer with a tax break.

title: Black Rhinos, Horns Cut Off, Lose Some of Their Gusto
description: New research shows a conservation strategy can disrupt the animals’ social networks.

title: A Saudi-China business conference underscores strengthening ties.
description: The kingdom hosted a lavish Arab-China business conference days after a visit from the American secretary of state, inviting companies blacklisted by the United States.

title: Nicola Sturgeon’s Arrest
description: Support for Scottish independence has dipped, but backing for Scotland remaining part of the United Kingdom is fragile, too. Nicola Sturgeon’s arrest leaves the fate of the movement in flux.

title: The Many Twists, Quotes and Scandals of Silvio Berlusconi
description: The former prime minister of Italy reveled in the spotlight, even when it shined on him for causing offense.

title: How Silvio Berlusconi Changed Italy
description: Whether as a politician or media tycoon, the former prime minister and businessman who died Monday at 86, left an imprint, or a bruise, on just about everything he touched.

title: Elizabeth Gilbert, Author of ‘Eat, Pray, Love,’ Pulls New Book Set In Russia
description: Elizabeth Gilbert delayed her new novel indefinitely after an online backlash condemned the book’s publication while Russia is at war with Ukraine.

title: UN Nuclear Watchdog to Assess Dam Disaster Aftermath in Ukraine
description: Rafael Mariano Grossi said he would meet with President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine and present a plan for assistance in the aftermath of floods unleashed by the Kakhovka dam’s destruction.

title: U.S. Will Rejoin UNESCO in July, Agency Says
description: The decision came after over a decade of turbulent relations between American administrations and the United Nation’s cultural organization.

title: Militia in Congo Kills Dozens at Camp for Internally Displaced
description: The attack was attributed to a group that the United Nations says has killed hundreds of civilians in the region and forced thousands to flee.

title: The Guardian Apologizes For Its Handling of Sexual Harassment Complaints
description: The British media company is also changing its internal processes following a New York Times investigation into a former star political columnist.

title: Silvio Berlusconi’s Allies and Enemies React to His Death
description: The former Italian prime minister and media mogul, who died at 86, was a divisive figure, but even his foes acknowledged that he was an influential political and cultural force.

title: U.S. Will Rejoin UNESCO in July, Agency Says
description: The decision came after over a decade of turbulent relations between American administrations and the United Nation’s cultural organization.

title: Ukraine Claims Further Small Gains in Early Stages of Counteroffensive
description: Kyiv says it has retaken another village in eastern Ukraine, as the campaign to push back Russian forces takes shape.

title: NATO Kicks Off Its Biggest Air Force Drills Since End of Cold War
description: More than 250 aircraft from 24 NATO countries and Japan will participate in a two-week military exercise.

title: Permission to Build
description: We’re covering a faster path to clean energy, the death of Silvio Berlusconi and the Tony Awards.

title: Hong Kong Judge Delays Decision on Ban of ‘Glory to Hong Kong’
description: The government, seeking a broad order to stop the internet distribution of “Glory to Hong Kong,” will return to court next month to address a judge’s questions.

title: Silvio Berlusconi, a Showman Who Upended Italian Politics and Culture, Dies at 86
description: He introduced sex and glamour to Italian TV, and then brought the same formula to politics, dominating the country and its culture for more than 20 years.

title: Fear and Mayhem as Russia’s War Comes Home
description: Attacks from Ukraine have killed at least a dozen Russian civilians and displaced thousands. But they have not fundamentally changed the calculus for Vladimir Putin.

title: ‘The State Killed My Brother’: Senegal in Uproar After Deadly Protests
description: After several protesters were killed by live ammunition this month in Senegal, many in the usually stable West African nation wonder what comes next.

title: ‘Everything will die’: The dam blast imperils Ukraine’s vital lifeline.
description: A disaster unfolds in slow motion after a blast destroys the dam at the Kakhovka Reservoir, emptying its waters and threatening livelihoods and industries crucial to Ukraine.

title: China’s Coast Guard and the Fight to Control Asia
description: Beijing’s patrol vessels often resemble warships. Now other nations are trying to compete with tougher coast guards of their own.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Nicola Sturgeon is arrested in Scotland.
